title: Write
text:
Writing SEGY files mirrors the reading workflow.

import numpy as np
import pysegy as seg

fh = seg.FileHeader()
fh.bfh.ns = 2
fh.bfh.DataSampleFormat = 5

# two traces with minimal headers
hdr = seg.BinaryTraceHeader()
hdr.ns = 2

data = np.array([[1.0], [2.0]], dtype=np.float32)
block = seg.SeisBlock(fh, [hdr], data)

seg.segy_write("out.segy", block)

Writing SEGY file out.segy
Finished writing out.segy


The pysegy.segy_write helper takes a pysegy.SeisBlock and writes a complete SEGY file to disk.

title: Scan
text:
Scanning allows inspecting large surveys without loading everything in memory.

import pysegy as seg

# scan all matching files in the repository data directory
data_dir = "../data"
scan = seg.segy_scan(data_dir, "overthrust_2D_shot_*.segy")

print(len(scan.shots))  # number of shot records
print(scan.counts[0])   # traces in the first shot

title: Read
text:
This page shows how to read SEGY data using pysegy.

import pysegy as seg

# path to a SEGY file shipped with the repository
path = "../data/overthrust_2D_shot_1_20.segy"

# load the file into memory
block = seg.segy_read(path)

# file header information
print(block.fileheader.bfh.ns)

Reading SEGY file ../data/overthrust_2D_shot_1_20.segy
Loaded header ns=751 dt=4000 from ../data/overthrust_2D_shot_1_20.segy
751


Use pysegy.segy_read to read an entire file in one call. The returned pysegy.SeisBlock contains the file header, trace headers and data array.

title: pysegy
text:
pysegy is a minimal Python library for reading and writing SEGY Rev 1 files. The package focuses on simplicity and provides helpers to parse headers and traces from local files.


Install the project in editable mode from the repository root:
python -m pip install -e .



Run the unit tests with pytest:
pytest -vs
The tests run automatically on GitHub Actions with coverage reports uploaded to Codecov.
